Situation1: All household chores must be coordinated because relatives are visiting, and the home needs to be fully presentable.
Expectation2: Assemble and construct wooden frameworks, furniture, or cabinetry
Situation2: A new furniture order comes in, and the carpenter should estimate material requirements and order supplies as needed
Story: I stood in the kitchen, the scent of cleaning spray sharp in the air, my phone buzzing insistently in my pocket. My spouse was bustling around, her voice echoing from the hallway, “Can you vacuum the living room next? My cousins will be here in three hours!” I nodded, but my mind was already drifting to the workshop. The text on my phone was from a client: a rush order for a custom bookshelf, needed by the end of the week. I had to estimate the wood, hardware, and finish, and place the order today if I wanted the materials in time. My hands itched to grab my notepad and start sketching, but the vacuum waited, and so did the dust on the shelves. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in—my partner counting on me to help make our home shine, my client expecting my craftsmanship and reliability. My heart thudded with anxiety as I stared at the vacuum, the phone still buzzing, torn between the demands of home and the call of my craft.
